title: Lets Chat - Gaming History - Most Memorable Game/Experience
body:
So, Boards seems pretty dead, except for the consistent attacks on riot. Lets make it a little more lively and get to know each other a little bit (as a community should)

With that, i pose a few questions:

1. What is your most memorable gaming experience? (speedruns/nuzlockes/outplays etc.)
2. What was the earliest game you played? (Was it on the old consoles, was it a favorite game etc.)
3. What was your very first experience with games? Was it on Console or Computer?

For me, my most memorable gaming experience came when i was about 9 years old, the Sega Mega Drive had just been released, as far as I've been told (my memory is fairly dodgy) i was so excited for it, that the minute i got it for Christmas, i played it for 8 hours straight, prior to this i hadn't played too many games.

The earliest game i remember playing was the original Age of Empires games (still love them to this day), and as for the mega drive, i played a game called Zoom, and of course Sonic the Hedgehog (i still play these two games too, we have the reloaded version of the Mega Drive, since we don't have the attachments for the old one)

So how about you guys/girls?
